page.title: 01Kirtling, rural west Suffolk
page.content: Gently rolling countryside covering the parish of Kirtling & parts of Lidgate, Cowlinge & Great Bradley. Predominantly arable farmland growing barley,wheat,rape,potatoes and peas. Pasture for horses,sheep & cows. Wood- land & copses of deciduous & conifer- ous trees providing cover for game birds & deer.Pastimes include pheasant shooting,foxhunting,rambling & riding along the numerous footpaths & bridle- ways. Ample gardens surround both old & modern houses producing flowers & in many cases,enough vegetables to supply the household needs.Employment is on the land or in neighbouring towns,the nearest being Newmarket. There is an interesting Norman parish church & a Catholic church.A fine gatehouse,known as Kirtling Towers remains on the moated site of the Old Kirtling Hall.
